document_title: Left testicular pain: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
For left testicular pain, the doctor will initially conduct a physical examination and ask some questions related to symptoms, severity, location of pain, medical history... Then, a Several diagnostic methods can be prescribed to ensure the most accurate conclusions, including: (5)
Doppler ultrasound of the scrotum, testicles and epididymis; Cases of suspected testicular cancer require micro-computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging to clearly determine the tumor structure and images of metastases, if any.; Testicular biopsy determines the nature of the testicular tumor; Blood count test.; Urine test.; Culture testicular fluid and urethral fluid to look for bacteria and do antibiograms.
